title: reinhardt_(overwatch)
body:
[i]"Justice will be done."[/i]

Real Name: Reinhardt Wilhelm
Age: 61
Occupation: Adventurer
Country: Germany

A tank-class character in [[Overwatch]]. Reinhardt Wilhelm styles himself as a champion of a bygone age, who lives by the knightly codes of valor, justice, and courage. Possessing an "active imagination," he enjoys eating currywurst, and is a fan of David Hasselhoff's music.

h4. Alternate skins
* [[balderich_reinhardt|Balderich Reinhardt]]
* [[Stonehardt]]

h4. Limited event skins

* [[Wujing Reinhardt]]

h4. External links

* "Overwatch wiki":[http://overwatch.gamepedia.com/Reinhardt]

title: ryuusou
body:
琉装 ([i]Ryuusou[/i], "Ryukyuan clothes") or 琉球衣装 (Ryūkyū clothes)

[[okinawa|Okinawan]] [[traditional clothes]] of the "Ryuyu (Ryūkyū/Ryuukyuu) Kingdom":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ryukyu_Kingdom], usually used for ceremonial occasions and Ryukyuan dance. Unlike Japanese [[kimono]], a Ryukyuan dress is not supposed to be worn with an [[obi]].

h4.See also

* [[okinawa]]
* [[traditional clothes]]
* [[hanagasa]]

title: count_blocken
body:
[b]Count Blocken[/b] (also known as [b]Count Brocken[/b]) is a villain character from [[Nagai Gou]]'s [[Mazinger Z]] [[super robot]] franchise, notable for being a [[Nazi]] with a disembodied head.  

Along with [[Baron Ashura]] (whom he despises), he is one of [[Doctor Hell]]'s lieutenants.

title: kel-tec_rdb
body:
The [[Kel-Tec RDB]] (Rifle, Downward-ejection, Bullpup) is a 5.56×45mm NATO [[bullpup]] type semi-automatic [[rifle]], manufactured by [[Kel-Tec]] Industries of Florida. 

It uses a rotary bolt with a spring loaded ejector and an extractor facing down, ejecting spent shell casings downward, allowing ambidextrous use.

title: kel-tec_ksg
body: The Kel-Tec KSG is a [[bullpup]] 12-gauge pump action [[shotgun]] designed by [[Kel-Tec]]. It has two tube magazines which the user of the [[gun]] can switch between manually. Each tube holds a total of seven  12-gauge shells

title: ancient_greece_(hetalia)
body: [[Axis Powers Hetalia]] [[personification|representation]] of Ancient Greece. The mother of [[greece (hetalia)|Greece]], described as having been very laid-back and easygoing. She had [[long hair|long]], [[black hair]].

title: saxony_(hetalia)
body: [[Axis Powers Hetalia]]'s [[personification]] of Saxony, a German Federal State. He has long [[blonde hair|blond hair]] like his [[germania (hetalia)|ancestor]]. He is depicted as [[germany (hetalia)|Germany]]'s older brother.

title: tibet_(hetalia)
body:
[i][[Axis Powers Hetalia]][/i]'s [[personification|representation]] of Tibet. He is depicted as a young, [[bald]] monk. He is stated as variously pitiful.

[tn]Adapted from Hetalia Archives[/tn]

title: ideakaedi
body: Female Indonesian artist.

title: howard_the_spy_(hetalia)
body:
[b]Howard[/b] was a minor character in [[Axis Powers Hetalia]].

He was an English spy stationed in Rome. He first appeared in Axis Powers Hetalia Volume 3 in the manga and episode 9 of the 4th season of the anime.

He had a grandson that works as a secretary for [[united kingdom (hetalia)|England]].

title: nata_hatchet
body: The nata is a Japanese tool for use in gardening and forestry, similar to that of a machete or bushknife. It is used to chop kindling, cut or prune trees and bushes, and for splitting smaller logs, and debarking. Nata are normally sharpened only on the right side of the blade, so they can be used to prune branches right at the stem or trunk of a tree.

body:
An ammunition & bomb researcher.
Although he is an artist, he often collaborates with "Karashi Mentaiko Gochou":http://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=3182320 on making military&girl-themed doujin books. Their doujinshi, themed on "the bombing of Tokyo":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bombing_of_Tokyo and "bomb disposal operations,":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bomb_disposal  are well worth reading.

title: grillwalker
body:
A company and portable grill system invented by Bertram Rohloff. It consists of a vending tray-like [[grill]] worn on the front, a backpack that houses a propane tank, and a parasol supported from the backpack.

Started in Berlin to sell hot bratwurst on the streets.

body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character.

A [[wakizashi]]. His character and design is largely based around the Japanese folktale of [[Urashima Tarou]]. He has a pet turtle named [[Kamekichi]]. Usually made to be in love with [[Midare Toushirou]] in fanworks, which stems from how he falls in love with Midare while believing he was a girl in the manga anthology [i]Danshi Makuaigeki[/i].

title: hi_no_tori
body:
[b]Phoenix[/b] (火の鳥 [i]Hi no Tori[/i], "Bird of Fire") is a manga series created by [[Tezuka Osamu]]. 

Tezuka considered [[Phoenix]] his "Life's work". It is collected in 12 manga books, each one telling a separate, self-contained story and taking place in different eras. The plots go back and forth from the remote future ([[Science Fiction]]) to ancient times. The cycle remains unfinished because of Tezuka's death. Most of the stories deal with the search for immortality and reincarnation, symbolized by the [[phoenix|mythical firebird]].

Several of the stories have been adapted into anime series and OVAs, and even a live-action movie. As of 2007, the entire manga series is available in English-language translations.

h4. See also

* [[hi_no_tori_2772|Phoenix 2772]]

title: ki-46
body:
The [b]Mitsubishi Ki-46[/b] was a Japanese reconnaissance aircraft aircraft during the Second World War. The Japanese Army designation was "[b]Type 100 Command Reconnaissance Aircraft[/b]" (一〇〇式司令部偵察機). Its Allied reporting name was [b]Dinah[/b].

It had a crew of two (a pilot and an observer), powered by two engines, had long range and was faster than most fighter planes of its era. Like most Japanese military planes such as the [[A6M Zero]] and [[Ki-43 Hayabusa]], it achieved that performance at the expense of armor and self-sealing fuel tanks.

It was designed by Kubo Tomio [久保 富夫] and entered combat for first time in July 1941. Later in the war, it was modified as a high-altitude interceptor.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia (JP): "Mitsubishi Ki-46":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%80%E3%80%87%E3%80%87%E5%BC%8F%E5%8F%B8%E4%BB%A4%E9%83%A8%E5%81%B5%E5%AF%9F%E6%A9%9F
* Wikipedia (EN): "Mitsubishi Ki-46":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitsubishi_Ki-46

title: joypolis
body:
A series of indoor amusement parks run by [[SEGA]]. 

The park frequently collaborates with different anime and game series, and will often have its characters wear the employee uniform in promotional art. This uniform consists of an accented black and white jacket with is either striped or has a large spot accent, and comes with a black skirt or dress pants.

h4. External Links
* "Official Site":http://tokyo-joypolis.com

title: dishonored
body:
A 2012 stealth action-adventure video game developed by Arkane Studios and published by Bethesda Softworks. It was released worldwide in October 2012 for Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 3, and Xbox 360. Set in the fictional, plague-ridden industrial city of Dunwall, Dishonored follows the story of [[Corvo Attano]], bodyguard to the Empress of the Isles. He is framed for her murder and forced to become an assassin, seeking revenge on those who conspired against him. Corvo is aided in his quest by the Loyalists—a resistance group fighting to reclaim Dunwall, and the Outsider—a powerful being who imbues Corvo with magical abilities.

(Source: Wikipedia)

title: rakugo
body:
A form of Japanese entertainment involving storytelling. A [[solo|single person]], the [i]rakugoka[/i], sits on stage and tells a long comical story with only a [[folding fan]] and a [[tenugui]] as props.

h4. See also 
* "Wikipedia Page":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rakugo
* [i][[Joshiraku]][/i]
* [i][[Shouwa Genroku Rakugo Shinjuu]][/i]
* [i][[Shouten]][/i] - Game show based on [i]rakugo[/i] storytelling

title: trunk
body:
Ambiguous tag. Do not use.

Possible uses of the word "trunk" include:

* [[Car trunk]] for the luggage compartment of a car.
* Various containers including [[suitcase|suitcases]], [[rolling_suitcase|rolling suitcases]], and [[treasure_chest|treasure chests]].
* The central part of a [[tree]]. See also [[tree stump]] and [[log]].
* The proboscis of an [[elephant]].

title: jagan_wa_gachirin_ni_tobu
body:
A.k.a. [i]Wicked Eyes Fly to the Full Moon[/i].
Short manga written by Fujita Kazuhiro, author of Ushio to Tora and Karakuri Circus. A cursed snowy owl with the power to kill anything it lays eyes on (codenamed "Minerva" by US authorities) cuts a bloody swath through the Tokyo area, and two American officers cooperate with an old mountaineer, the only person that was ever able to wound the creature, and his daughter in order to take it down.

h4.External Link

* "Wikipedia article (JP)":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%82%AA%E7%9C%BC%E3%81%AF%E6%9C%88%E8%BC%AA%E3%81%AB%E9%A3%9B%E3%81%B6]

h4.See also

* [[yabai]] ([[Nijiura Maids]])

title: kuroneko_no_toorimichi
body:
Circle. (dissolved)
Seems to be run by three people: やつき (Yatsuki), たくずぃー ([[Takuzui]]) and たこ (Tako).
Posted images and links belong to the artist, Yatsuki (やつき).

「やつき」、「たくずぃー」、「たこ」による合同サークル。
2009年3月8日の第六回博麗神社例大祭をもって解散。
以降は個人サークルとして活動。
やつき: 水銀革命
たくずぃー: 路草

title: ki-43_hayabusa
body:
The [b]Nakajima Ki-43 Hayabusa[/b] (隼, "Peregrine Falcon") was a Japanese fighter aircraft during the Second World War. The Japanese Army designation was "[b]Army Type 1 Fighter[/b]" (一式戦闘機). Its Allied reporting name was [b]Oscar[/b].

The Ki-43 was similar to the [[A6m Zero]] in terms of appearance. As a result, it was called the "Army Zero" by American pilots. Being powered by the same engine as the A6M Zero but even more lightweight, it had high maneuverability but did not have armor or self-sealing fuel tanks. Also, it had weak armament of only two machine guns (7.7 x 58 mm SR Type 89 machine guns or 12.7 x 81 mm Ho-103 machine guns, both of which were inadequate against Allied aircraft. There were two prototypes with two 20 x 94 mm Ho-5 cannons each) due to the lightweight construction preventing the placement of machine guns or cannons in the wings.

It was designed by Itokawa Hideo [糸川 英夫] and entered combat for first time in October 1941.

h4. See also

* [[Ki-84 Hayate]] - its successor
* [[List of airplanes]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia (JP): "Nakajima Ki-43 Hayabusa":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%80%E5%BC%8F%E6%88%A6%E9%97%98%E6%A9%9F
* Wikipedia (EN): "Nakajima Ki-43 Hayabusa":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nakajima_Ki-43

title: d3a
body:
The [b]Aichi D3A Type 99[/b] Carrier Bomber, also known by it's Allied reporting name "Val", was the main dive bomber for the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] during [[World War II]].

It saw action from Pearl Harbor to the Phillipines, from Midway to the Eastern Solomons and until the Kamikaze attacks. The Val has been credited with sinking more Allied warships than any other Axis aircraft with a total of 14 (5 British, 1 Australian and 8 American ships; with 2 of them being on Kamikaze missions).

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia (JP): "Aichi D3A Type 99":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B9%9D%E4%B9%9D%E5%BC%8F%E8%89%A6%E4%B8%8A%E7%88%86%E6%92%83%E6%A9%9F
* Wikipedia (EN): "Aichi D3A Type 99":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aichi_D3A

title: train_conductor
body:
A member of a railway [[train]]'s crew that is responsible for operational and safety duties that do not involve the actual operation of the train. Specific job responsibilities for a conductor-type position include ensuring that the train adheres to its schedule, ensuring that any cars or cargo are picked up or dropped off at the proper place, completing en-route paperwork, ensuring that the train follows applicable safety rules and practices, controlling the train's movement while operating in reverse, coupling or decoupling cars, assisting with the setting out or picking up of rolling stock, carrying out running repairs, ticket collection and various customer service duties.

h4.List of characters called "(Train) Conductor" ("Shashou")

* [[conductor_(ginga_tetsudou_999)|Conductor]] ([[Ginga Tetsudou 999]])
* [[conductor_(doraemon)|Conductor]] ([[Doraemon]]: "Nobita and the Galaxy Super-express":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doraemon:_Nobita_and_the_Galaxy_Super-express]/Nobita to Ginga Chou-Tokkyuu)
* [[conductor_(ressha_sentai_toqger)|Conductor]] ([[Ressha Sentai ToQger]]).

h4.See also

* [[train attendant]]

title: hip_attack
body:
A wrestling move, also known as a butt bump/butt thump, where the person (usually with a running start) jumps into the air toward their target, turning around in the air, and then thrusting their rear end out to hit their opponent with either the buttocks or hip.

[[WWE]] wrestlers Naomi and Asuka, and [[New Japan Pro Wrestling]]'s Taguchi Ryusuke are popular users of this move.

title: b5n
body:
The [b]Nakajima B5N[/b] was the standard carrier torpedo bomber of the Imperial Japanese Navy (IJN) for much of World War II. Its full designation was "[b]Type 97 Carrier Attack Bomber[/b]" (九七式艦上攻撃機) and its Allied reporting name was [b]Kate[/b].

Despite being obsolete by 1941 (having lack of armor, self-sealing fuel tanks and being slow), the B5N operated throughout the whole war, due to the delayed development of its successor, the B6N. 

There were two variants. The B5N1 first saw combat in the Sino-Japanese War where it revealed several weaknesses. An effort to solve them included fitting the more powerful Sakae Model 11 engine (this was the same engine which powered the [[A6M Zero]]). This improved version was designated the B5N2 and primarily saw service with the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]], achieving success in the early part of World War II by sinking several battleships and aircraft carriers.

h4. See also

* [[B6N Tenzan]] - its successor
* [[List of airplanes]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia (JP): "Nakajima B5N":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B9%9D%E4%B8%83%E5%BC%8F%E8%89%A6%E4%B8%8A%E6%94%BB%E6%92%83%E6%A9%9F
* Wikipedia (EN): "Nakajima B5N":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nakajima_B5N

title: b6n_tenzan
body:
The [b]Nakajima B6N Tenzan[/b] (天山, "Heavenly Mountain") was the standard carrier torpedo bomber of the Imperial Japanese Navy (IJN) during the final years of World War II. Its Allied reporting name was [b]Jill[/b].

While a capable aircraft, its protracted development meant that it was operating under the United States Navy's achievement of air superiority (which included having to deal with aircraft which outclassed it such as the [[F6F Hellcat]]) by the time of its introduction. Coupled with a shortage of experienced pilots prevented it from achieving its full potential. 

h4. See also

* [[B5N]] - its predecessor
* [[List of airplanes]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Nakajima B6N":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nakajima_B6N

body:

Based on Melinda Lou "Wendy" Thomas, the daughter of company founder Dave Thomas.

title: noda_megumi
body:
Female protagonist of [[Nodame Cantabile]], and possibly the title character of the series as she is often referred to as "Nodame". 

She starts off as a free-spirited second-year music student who is a complete slob: her cooking and cleaning skills are atrocious to the point of having mushrooms growing on her clothes and poisoning anyone who dares to eat her food (yet she's never been poisoned herself). However, she is an incredibly talented pianist who primarily plays by ear, in a cantabile style. 

Her piano style is considered to be completely haphazard, diverting from original intent at both dynamics, rhythms and even themes. Despite this, several people have commented on how captivating her piano is, and how she is able to draw rich, expressive notes from the piano. 

Nodame's character is based on a real-life counterpart with same name.

title: neapolitan_ice_cream
body: A type of [[ice cream]] that in itself isn't a flavor, but rather a combination of three specific flavors: vanilla, chocolate, and strawberry. Neapolitan ice cream will be shown as white, brown, and pink ice cream merged but not completely blended together.

title: ice_cream_on_face
body: When there is a dollop of [[ice cream]] stuck to a character's face, usually around their mouth after consuming it.

title: ice_cream_cone_on_head
body: When there is an [[ice cream cone]] sitting upside-down on a person's head. Sometimes there's [[ice cream]] smushed between the cone and the head, but sometimes the cone may be worn as a miniature [[hat]].

title: rideback
body:
[b]Rideback[/b] (ライドバック - [i]Raidobakku[/i]), stylized as [b]RIDEBACK[/b] or [b]RideBack[/b], is a Japanese [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] manga series created by [[Kasahara Tetsurou]]. It was serialized in Shogakukan's monthly [i]Ikki[/i] magazine from March 2003 to January 2009, spanning a total of ten volumes. 

Set in Japan in 2020, it follows the story of female student [[Ogata Rin]] as she comes across a variable [[motorcycle]]/[[robot]] hybrid called [[Fuego]]. 

In 2009, it was adapted into an anime TV series by Madhouse. At Anime Central 2010, anime distributor Funimation announced that they licensed the series for North America with its release planned for 2011.

h4. Characters

* [[Kataoka Tamayo]]
* [[Uchida Suzuri]]
* [[Umemura Shouko]]
* [[Yoda Megumi]]
* [[Yokoyama Misawo]]

h4.External Links

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rideback]

title: j2m_raiden
body:
The [b]Mitsubishi J2M Raiden[/b] (雷電, "Thunderbolt") was a single engine land based fighter aircraft used by the Imperial Japanese Navy Air Service in World War II. The Allied reporting name was [b]Jack[/b].

The J2M was designed by [[Horikoshi Jirou]], creator of the famed [[A6M Zero]]. It was to be a strictly local-defense interceptor intended to counter the threat of high-altitude bomber raids and thus relied on speed, climb performance, and armament at the expense of maneuverability. 

The J2M was a sleek, but stubby craft with its oversized Mitsubishi Kasei engine buried behind a long cowling, cooled by an intake fan and connected to the propeller with an extension shaft.

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Mitsubishi J2M Raiden":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitsubishi_J2M

title: mc.202_folgore
body:
A World War II Italian fighter [[aircraft]] developed and produced by Macchi Aeronautica from 1941 to 1948. Marking a break with tradition, the MC.202 [i]Folgore[/i] ("Thunderbolt") was powered by a license-built Daimler-Benz DB.601 instead of an Italian engine, resulting in an aircraft with good top speed and performance at par with contemporary Allied fighters. Recognition features include the long, streamlined nose and exhaust stacks indicative of a liquid-cooled engine, a three-bladed [[propeller]], underfuselage radiator, straight wings with rounded tips (the port wing longer by 21.59 cm (8.5 in)), an antenna mast just behind the raised, faired canopy, and a non-retracting tailwheel.

The MC.202 was armed with 2 Breda-SAFAT 12.7 x 81 mm machine guns mounted in the nose cowling. Later batches added 2 7.7 mm machine guns in the wings (these tended to be removed due to their weight and their ineffectiveness against Allied aircraft). Underwing stores could include 2 bombs or two 100-liter drop tanks.

h4. See also

* [[MC.200 Saetta]]
* [[MC.205 Veltro]]
* [[List of Airplanes]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Macchi MC.202":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macchi_C.202

title: sb2c_helldiver
body:
The Curtiss SB2C Helldiver was a carrier-based dive bomber aircraft produced for the United States Navy during World War II. It replaced the Dogulas [[SBD Dauntless]].

Early versions suffered from reliability problems which were eventually ironed out by using a more powerful engine in the SB2C-3.

The aircraft was the last purpose-built dive bomber produced, its role replaced by air-to-ground rockets which have the same precision as a dive bomber without the need for demanding performance requirements.

h4.See also

title: blobfish
body:
[i]Psychrolutes marcidus[/i]

A deep-sea fish most relevant to Danbooru for its gelatinous body, large "nose" and large pink lips, and subsequent "drooping"/"melting" human-like facial features.  Blobfish are somewhat like a [[meme]], referenced either for its melting face-like appearance to demonstrate some sort of emotion, or as an "ugly-cute" character for a (typically female) character to like to show she's weird.  

h4. See Also:
* "Wikipedia on the real animal.":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blobfish

title: crystalline
body:
Fantasy visual novel under development by PixelFade Studio (creators of [[Ace Academy]]). Fully voice acted in English. Animated character portraits. Demo available via Steam or Kickstarter page. 
[quote]
Crystalline is a comedy-centric, fantasy adventure, visual novel with an in-depth romance system. With hundreds of choices available, you can experience the storyline and interact with characters in a much more personalized way.

The protagonist finds himself mysteriously transported to Terra, a fantasy world empowered by magical crystals. Not long after arriving does he run into Leanna, a Mage-Knight investigating instances of concentrated energy in the area… which she learns is radiating from him! Together, they journey to understand how he got here and a way for him to return home. They soon discover that his arrival to Terra is more than just a coincidence!
[/quote]

h4. Characters: 
* [[hero_(crystalline)|Hero]] (player protagonist)
* [[Leanna Dawn]] - CV: Amanda Lee
* [[Zack Spade]] - CV: Nathan Sharp
* [[Amelia Estelle]] - CV: Natalie Hoover
* [[Kara Noir]] - CV: Amber Lee Connors
* [[pango_(crystalline)|Pango]] - CV: Angela Lorenzana

h4. Links: 
* Website: http://www.pixelfade.com/portfolio/crystalline/
* Steam: http://store.steampowered.com/app/616250/
* Kickstarter: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2081517796/crystalline-visual-novel-game
* VNDB: https://vndb.org/v19989

title: terui_ryuu
body:
A character from [[Kamen Rider W]].

A young superintendent transferred into the Fuuto Police Department to deal with the increasing cases of Dopant attacks. He also bears a personal vendetta against a Dopant that murdered his family.

With help from a mysterious veiled woman only known as Shroud, he is given the AccelDriver belt to transform into [[Kamen Rider Accel]].

title: ace_academy
body:
English-language visual novel by PixelFade Studio. 
[quote]
In the year 2049, mechanized robots commonly called GEAR were developed for military application. Since then, their versatile functionality has led them to not only become commonplace in commercial use, but also spawned an entire sports entertainment industry. The prevalent use and popularity of GEARs has created a new academic field known as “Cenorobotics”.

Due to unforeseeable circumstances, the protagonist finds himself transferring to ACE Academy, a premier school for Cenorobotics studies in Japan. He struggles to find a team willing to accept him and his outdated “American” GEAR to compete in the intramural tournament. When compared to the sleek, robust, and advanced technologies of the Japanese counterparts, his search feels utterly hopeless. That is, until he finds a group of pilots just desperate enough for another member. This is where your story begins.
[/quote]
Originally funded on Kickstarter as "Kendo Crush!": https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2081517796/kendo-crush-visual-novel-game

See also [[Crystalline]], PixelFade Studio's next VN project.

h4. Links: 
* Website: http://www.pixelfade.com/portfolio/aceacademy/
* Steam: http://store.steampowered.com/app/396650/
* VNDB: https://vndb.org/v13948

title: dowsing_rod
body:
A Y or L shaped rod used for divining the location of water, oils, gravesites, or finding radioactive materials. Dowsing rods are sometimes used in a way not too dissimilar from a Ouija board, in which you ask a question and if the Dowsing rod moves the answer is yes.  It can be made from a variety of materials. 

Dowsing can also be conducted with a pendulum made of a crystal, or other materials, to find the location of materials. It works in a similar fashion to the rods, with the crystal pointing in the direction of the desired objective.

There are modern electronic Dowsing rods, notably used by the Iraqi military to detect explosives, but none have proven effective.

[[Nazrin]] from the [[Touhou]] series is associated with both the rod and the crystal method of dowsing.

title: tales_of_rebirth
body:
The sixth mothership title for Namco's [[tales of (series)|Tales of...]] series released for the Playstation 2 and rereleased for the Playstation Portable. It was never localized to the West. Tales of Rebirth utilizes the Three-Line Linear Motion Battle System, which tweaks the traditional 2D field by dividing it into three lines. Also notable for the notorious "CLAAAAIRE!!" meme, which even the developers have incorporated into side material whenever Veigue appears.

title: tagalog
body: The official dialect and often the assumed official language (by name) of the Philippines. While it is the lingua franca of the Philippines, it is formally known as the Filipino language. Both terms (Tagalog and Filipino) are used interchangeably. The name comes from the word "Taga-ilog" (river-dwellers) whose spoken language became the basis for modern Filipino. The language has plenty of loanwords and is often code-switched with English. While it is historically written in Baybayin script, Tagalog is written using Latin characters.

title: j8m_shuusui
body:
An experimental rocket-powered interceptor jointly developed for the [[Imperial Japanese Army]] and [[imperial_japanese_navy|Navy]] Air Services during [[World War II]].  It was essentially a copy of the German Messerschmitt [[Me 163]] [i]Komet[/i].  Seven prototypes were built, only one of which was flown (once, and it crashed) before the end of the war brought the project to a halt.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitsubishi_J8M]

title: hentai_ouji_to_warawanai_neko.
body:
変態王子と笑わない猫。, lit. [i]The "HENTAI" Prince and the Stony Cat.[/i]

A 2010-current light novel series by Saraga Sou, with illustration by [[Kantoku]], published under Media Factory's [i]MF Bunko J[/i] imprint. Also adapted into a 2011 manga in Media Factory's [i]Monthly Comic Alive[/i] by Okomeken, and a Spring 2013 anime by J.C.Staff.

[[Yokodera Youto]]'s inability to express his true desires gets in the way of seducing girls. [[Tsutsukakushi Tsukiko]]'s penchant for saying whatever pops into her head causes her appear childish. After making wishes at the legendary Stony Cat statue, Youto becomes unable to suppress his lust and Tsukiko becomes emotionless. Together, they look for ways to fix their messed up personalities.

h4. Characters

* [[Azuki Azusa]]
* [[Emanuella Porlallora]]
* [[Tsutsukakushi Tsukiko]]
* [[Tsutsukakushi Tsukushi]]
* [[Yokodera Youto]]

h4. External links

* "Official Site":http://www.mediafactory.co.jp/bunkoj/book_detail/650
* "Official Site (anime)":http://www.henneko.jp/
* "[i]Hentai Ouji to Warawanai Neko.[/i] on Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hentai_Ouji_to_Warawanai_Neko

title: cottonee
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #546 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Grass/Fairy Pokémon. Prior to Generation VI, it was a pure Grass type.
Cottonee is a white, circular Pokémon. It has white, puffy sections on the top of its head and its underside. Behind it is a green, star shaped section similar to the area where a plant connects to its produce. It has orange, oval-shaped eyes, and furled, notched leaves on the sides of its body.

It evolves into [[Whimsicott]] via [i]Sun Stone[/i].
Japanese Name: [b]Monmen[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Scolipede]]
Next Pokémon: [[Whimsicott]]

title: heimlich_maneuver
body:
[i]"Abdominal thrusts (also called the Heimlich maneuver or Heimlich manoeuvre [...]) is a first aid procedure used to treat upper airway obstructions (or choking) by foreign objects. [...] Performing abdominal thrusts involves a rescuer standing behind a patient and using his or her hands to exert pressure on the bottom of the diaphragm. This compresses the lungs and exerts pressure on any object lodged in the trachea, hopefully expelling it."[/i]

- Wikipedia

Subjects of the Heimlich Maneuver are almost always choking. Not to be mistaken with [[cpr]], cardiopulmonary resuscitation, which attempts to artificially produce heart beats by pumping the chest area with both hands.

title: fuchibeppu_chiyuri
body:
A [[huge breasts|large]], [[plump|heavy-set]] young lady with an apathetic and lethargic demeanor, which is reflected in her constant [[half-closed eyes]] and her verbal tic, where she drops syllables in nearly every sentence. She also doesn't seem to mind her nameless boyfriend's constant [[groping|physical attention]].

Her appearance is based off of the [[Tibetan Sand Fox]], though she isn't technically one herself. She is usually drawn without a [[tail]], and while her [[pointy hair]]style resembles [[fox ears]], they might not necessarily be ears at all.

Her author of origin is (currently) unknown. [[tsukudani (coke-buta)]] and [[fukumaaya]] are the two candidates, and it's possible that they both created her.

title: samurai_(disgaea)
body:
The male version of the Samurai class seen in the [[Disgaea]] series. His default colors are brown hair and red clothes.

For the female version, see [[ronin (disgaea)]].

title: ronin_(disgaea)
body:
The female version of the Samurai class seen in the [[Disgaea]] series. Her default colors are long black hair done in a ponytail, a white sarashi and red hakama.

For the male version, see [[samurai (disgaea)]].

title: futhark
body:
A northern Germanic [[runes|runic]] script, characterized by their straight lines due to their supposed derivation from tossing divination twigs or bones and reading the patterns where they land.  The elder variant was transplanted into Britain during the Saxon invasion, while the younger variation was used by the Vikings.  

Made famous among CRPG circles by their use in the [[Ultima]] series of games, Futhark runes are a go-to rune for something meant to be obscure but also recognizably Western and Medieval. 

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia article on Elder Futhark":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elder_Futhark]
* "Wikipedia article on Younger Futhark":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Younger_Futhark]

title: christine_von_lerchenfeld
body:
One of the main heroine's of the Visual Novel Honoo no Haramase Motto! Hatsuiku! Shintai Sokutei 2
Voiced by: Aoba Ringo
Description
Grade: First Year
Height: 165.5cm
Three Sizes: B109.0 (S-cup) / W58 / H95
Affiliation: Valhalla Knights
Attributes: Noble and neat woman knight, childhood friend
Problems: Goes into a state of estrus when looking at swords, because they remind her of male genitals.
Erogenous Zone(s): Anal, underarms
Befitting of a knight, she is the nobly beautiful daughter of the Earl of the house of Lerchenfeld.
Her prowess as a knight is not only impressive, but her bust size is unmatched by any other.
She is an ambitious, non-conceited hard-worker. And her fighting style also has an aggressive side, which is achieved by shortening the distance between the her and the opponent instantly.
Since she's helped Shunosuke since they were children, she has always revered him.
Her all time favorite food is the hamburger, and she seems to evoke the effect of the more "invites" to Valhalla, referring to it as a "deadly hamburger".
